mods.abstract: : Pulmonary inflammation has got direct correlation with the progression of various respiratory inflammatory disorders. Numerous respiratory chronic disorders such as acute bronchitis, chronic obstructive pulmonary diseases (COPD), pulmonary emphysema progresses because of long term lung inflammation in and around the involved tissue. Several plant extracts and their polyphenolic constituents exhibited therapeutic effects on numerous preclinical lung inflammatory models. Flavonoids are the most studied polyphenolic composites, and their classification in different forms have been significantly investigated in relation to respiratory ailments. Presently, over 8000 flavonoids from different plants particularly have been explored for having anticancer, antioxidant, and anti-inflammatory potential. Various mechanisms of action of flavonoids have been implicated, but few studies are available to check the anti-inflammatory classes of flavonoids that were published in the last fifteen years. We searched Web of Sciences, Google Scholar, PubMed, Scopus, and Embase databases up to April 2021 by using the relevant keywords for this systemic review. : Recent reports showed a significant impact of flavonoids because of their antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, anticancer, etc., properties. Reported research and review articles signify that flavonoid might possibly impede inflammation, oxidative stress and can advance in the progression of different pulmonary function. : The flavonoids exhibited in various forms display wide-range of pharmacologic actions in regulating and monitoring various pulmonary disorders. Therefore, the valuable assets of flavonoids so far studied make them a unique candidate for various experimental studies. The main objective of this review was to display a comprehensive understanding of the beneficial activities of various flavonoids in the prevention and treatment of pulmonary illnesses, as well as the diverse phytoconstituents of different flavonoids in the treatment of pulmonary disorders.
